selected_metadata.horror_point: 2000年代初頭の日本のネットロアが持つアナログホラー的質感が新鮮。画面の枠を超えてくるメタフィクション的な恐怖が、スマホ視聴体験と完璧に合致する。

data.description: Have you ever encountered the cursed Red Room pop-up during a late-night browsing session? This Japanese Urban Legend tells of a mysterious window that appears out of nowhere, asking a chilling question. If you try to close it, you seal your fate. Is your room turning red yet? This short explores the dark depths of J-horror and the internet myths that haunted a generation. Stay until the end to see if you can escape the infection. Watch more Japanese Horror and Creepy Urban Legend stories on our channel. Are you brave enough to click? Tell us in the comments if you've seen the Red Room. Supernatural phenomena and digital curses await those who linger too long.
data.editorial_notes: Viral Architect: タイトル案は 1.「WARNING: Do NOT Close the Red Pop-up #Shorts」 2.「The Cursed Website You Must Avoid」 3.「Is Your Room Red Yet? #JHorror」の中から、最も視聴者の生存本能と好奇心を刺激する1を選定。YouTubeのアルゴリズムに『警告』として認識させるフックを重視しました。 The Whisperer: 日本の都市伝説『赤い部屋』をベースに、視聴者が自分のデバイスを通じて呪いに感染していくメタフィクション的な恐怖をナレーションに込めました。あえて説明しすぎず、問いかけることで不気味さを増幅させています。 The Visionary: 2000年代初頭のインターネット黎明期のアナログホラー的質感（CRTモニターの走査線やデジタルノイズ）をMidjourneyで再現。後半に向けて画面が赤に染まり、現実世界を侵食する視覚効果を狙っています。
data.vrew_script:
Have you ever heard of the Red Room
A cursed pop-up appearing at midnight
It starts as a small glitching window
A voice asks if you like the red room
If you try to close it the window grows
Spreading across your screen like a virus
Until everything is painted in deep crimson
The cursor moves on its own now
Cold hands reach out from the static
Your reality is being overwritten by code
Look around your walls are turning red
Now answer the question one last time
Do you like the red room
